html: Today, I sent a letter to leader's of the @HouseCommerce Health subcommittee seeking an investigation into the rising cost of insulin, which was developed a century ago. html: Last week, I introduced H.R. 1908, a bill to award a Congressional Gold Medal to Master Sergeant Rodrick “Roddie” Edmonds for his heroism and leadership during WWII. I appreciate the entire bipartisan Tennessee House delegation signing on as co-sponsors. https://burchett.house.gov/media/press-releases/congressman-burchett-introduces-bill-award-congressional-gold-medal-master …pic.twitter.com/oGBvTwkFMs
text:
Last week, I introduced H.R. 1908, a bill to award a Congressional Gold Medal to Master Sergeant Rodrick “Roddie” Edmonds for his heroism and leadership during WWII. I appreciate the entire bipartisan Tennessee House delegation signing on as co-sponsors.
https://burchett.house.gov/media/press-releases/congressman-burchett-introduces-bill-award-congressional-gold-medal-master …pic.twitter.com/oGBvTwkFMs

html: My predecessor, Congressman Duncan, originally filed this bill, and I think it’s an excellent piece of legislation that deserves bipartisan support. (3/3)
text: My predecessor, Congressman Duncan, originally filed this bill, and I think it’s an excellent piece of legislation that deserves bipartisan support. (3/3)

html: It’s not fair that when a company files for bankruptcy the big shots and insiders who caused the problem are able to receive huge bonuses while workers face layoffs. (2/3)
text: It’s not fair that when a company files for bankruptcy the big shots and insiders who caused the problem are able to receive huge bonuses while workers face layoffs. (2/3)

html: Proud to be an original cosponsor of the No Bonuses in Bankruptcy Act of 2019, which was introduced today and seeks to prevent companies that file for bankruptcy from rewarding highly paid employees and company insiders with fiscally irresponsible bonuses. (1/3)
text: Proud to be an original cosponsor of the No Bonuses in Bankruptcy Act of 2019, which was introduced today and seeks to prevent companies that file for bankruptcy from rewarding highly paid employees and company insiders with fiscally irresponsible bonuses. (1/3)

html: It’s unfortunate Congress couldn’t act to secure our border and that the President has been forced to declare a national emergency due to this inaction. The trafficking of drugs and humans across our border is an emergency, and we need to act now to address this crisis.
text: It’s unfortunate Congress couldn’t act to secure our border and that the President has been forced to declare a national emergency due to this inaction. The trafficking of drugs and humans across our border is an emergency, and we need to act now to address this crisis.

text:
Earlier today, @sendavidperdue and I, along with dozens of our colleagues, introduced resolutions in the House and Senate to recognize that America's national debt is a threat to our national security. 

STATEMENTS: https://bit.ly/2NvRwiy pic.twitter.com/iaeAILGqLy

html: ...and you can’t get serious about either one of those without a balanced budget. Families across the country sit at the dinner table balancing their checkbooks and living within their means, so why can’t the federal government do the same? (2/2)

html: Last week, I signed on to HR 714, the EL CHAPO Act. It seeks to fund border security and a border wall by using billions of dollars in seized drug money profits from drug cartels. This is a common sense approach to increase funding for border security and I'm happy to support it.
text: Last week, I signed on to HR 714, the EL CHAPO Act. It seeks to fund border security and a border wall by using billions of dollars in seized drug money profits from drug cartels. This is a common sense approach to increase funding for border security and I'm happy to support it.

html: Voted yes tonight on H.R. 1079 a bill that seeks to modernize the constituent service process by allowing privacy release forms to be electronically submitted. I’m happy to support improving government access and efficiency especially when it directly impacts taxpayers.
text: Voted yes tonight on H.R. 1079 a bill that seeks to modernize the constituent service process by allowing privacy release forms to be electronically submitted. I’m happy to support improving government access and efficiency especially when it directly impacts taxpayers.

html: Both in the state legislature and as mayor I focused on increasing openness and transparency in government, and this bill continues those efforts at the federal level.

html: ...but there’s more to do. This Act will help identify ways to track and disrupt the virtual currencies being used to fund these criminal industries. We need to put the dirtbags who run these trafficking rings behind bars, and this vote is a step in the right direction. (2/2)
text: ...but there’s more to do. This Act will help identify ways to track and disrupt the virtual currencies being used to fund these criminal industries. We need to put the dirtbags who run these trafficking rings behind bars, and this vote is a step in the right direction. (2/2)

html: Today I voted for HR502, the FIND Trafficking Act, a bipartisan bill that will help us understand how virtual currencies and the online marketplaces are used in sex and drug trafficking. I spent years in the Tennessee state legislature fighting against these issues... (1/2)
text: Today I voted for HR502, the FIND Trafficking Act, a bipartisan bill that will help us understand how virtual currencies and the online marketplaces are used in sex and drug trafficking. I spent years in the Tennessee state legislature fighting against these issues... (1/2)

html: While this continuing resolution solves the issue temporarily, we need a long-term solution that stays committed to solving the border crisis and finding a way to strengthen border security. (2/3)
text: While this continuing resolution solves the issue temporarily, we need a long-term solution that stays committed to solving the border crisis and finding a way to strengthen border security. (2/3)

html: “I’m happy that President Trump and leaders from both parties were able to negotiate an agreement to re-open the government. Hardworking folks have gone weeks without a paycheck and they deserve one immediately. (1/3)
text: “I’m happy that President Trump and leaders from both parties were able to negotiate an agreement to re-open the government. Hardworking folks have gone weeks without a paycheck and they deserve one immediately. (1/3)

html: Today, House Democrats: → voted NO to paying all federal workers who have been affected by the partial shutdown. → decided to leave early tomorrow and give themselves a three day weekend.
text:
Today, House Democrats:
→ voted NO to paying all federal workers who have been affected by the partial shutdown.
→ decided to leave early tomorrow and give themselves a three day weekend.

html: President @realDonaldTrump’s proposal goes before the Senate today. Let’s hope it passes. And if not, let’s stay in D.C. and work to find a solution, not close up shop and head back home as Democrats are suggesting.
